content.description: Hard slab. Thin. Crimpy. Bouldery.
content.protection: 5 bolts to ring anchors. Anchors can be approached from back side for top rope.
content.location: Right line, of two bolted routes on the largest/steepest south facing slab at the main formation.

content.description: Start on good ledge. Continue up center face of boulder. Needs a sit start!
content.location: see location for judo chop!

content.description: Start on east side of Split Boulder's smaller cleaved half. Use cheater boulder and left arete to gain the jug haul. Follow top edge to the apex of the cleaved half.
content.location: "Split Boulder" see directions from contemplation.

content.description:
Not really a crux on this route. It is fun and there are some cool pockets on the first part of the route.

Top anchor is a slung boulder on the back side of the formation. Not really a top rope candidate until bolts are placed at the top. It's an easy walk off to the west.
content.protection: Small trad gear no larger than 1 inch.
content.location: This route is on the south/southwestof the main rock formation.

content.description: Great climbing up a perfect and high face. This face shares the same awesome rock as The Shaped Wall. The line starts on the left edge and traverses toward the chimney. The first move is a big cross through to a shallow two finger pocket. There are a few jugs at mid height next to the chimney to rest on. Climb back to the center of the face and top out there. A sloper pull at the top is the crux.
content.protection: Crash Pads. This boulder has also been top roped using traditional anchors.
content.location:
This is on the south side of the Three Peaks formation. It is easy to identify if you look at the

topo for the south face of Three Peaks

content.description: Short Crack.
content.location: Left of Sport route

content.description: Slab route on west side of split boulder. Path of least resistance.
content.location: "Split Boulder" See directions from contemplation. West side on smaller cleaved half.

content.description: Following is problem beta. Sit Start to "Split Pea". Start hands matched on lower jug. I moved right hand up to the pocket right foot up to lower ledge. Pull left hand static to crimp down and left of heuco. Hit heuco with right hand and jug haul to top.
content.location: Located on the split boulder. North aspect on smaller cleaved half

content.description: Beta warning: Start left hand in high pocket, right hand on slopey arete/pinch. Foot on low ledge and "Hop Start" for easier grade or get on steady and he-man pull to huge hueco for legit start. Split Boulder Classic, Super Fun!
content.location: "Split Boulder" see directions from contemplation.

content.description: Another slab route on Split Boulder. Easier moves than Split Slab, but higher consequences and difficult to protect.
content.protection: Pads. The sweeping nature makes this difficult to protect. A couple spotters could be helpful.
content.location: West face of the larger (south) section of Split Boulder.

climbs.name: The Sharp Side of the Gully

content.description:
Step 10 feet away from the nice rock of the Shaped Wall and enter the realm of painful bouldering. Climb the tip of the boulder lying across from the shaped wall. Start on a big slopey edge then climb a right leaning arete.

There is a heel hook move and some slopey holds so maybe it does deserve a star by default.
content.location:
This is on the south side of the Three Peaks formation. It is easy to identify if you look at the

topo for the south face of Three Peaks

content.description: This is the best rock at Three Peaks. Climb a great vertical face using cool plates and jugs at the top. After a huge jug saves the day, the cliff turns to slab and climbs up about 20 more feet. It is a really high boulder problem that just about anyone could find the courage to do. There are a few problems and many variations have been done.
content.location:
This is on the south side of the Three Peaks formation. It is easy to identify if you look at the

topo for the south face of Three Peaks

content.description: Traverse problem with a topout. Start matched at chest height on right side of boulder and traverse left on the seam, top out around the corner. Bad feet to start, finish is slightly desperate.
content.location: Located on the mini split boulder, same block as "Judo Chop" and "White Belt".

content.description: Crack on the right side of the formation with the spray painted headless guy on it. Great mini sufferfest. Fun.
content.protection: Medium to Large Pro. There are two hangers at the top of the route that are easy to approach from the right side to set up TR.

content.description: A few offwidth moves down low, move into the crack when you can and chimney up to the top. A bit highball but secure once you can get inside.
content.location: Around back of Trump or Hillary, on the same block. Or approach from the South side and it will be visible on the left.

content.description: Slab to the right of Morning Dove.  Third bolt seems to be an old CMC hanger.  Slabby, flaky and in need of some traffic.
content.protection: Five bolts to two anchor bolts.

content.description: Mossy. Some loose rock. Meandering. Crux is the squeeze chimney. Fun for any novice leader.
content.protection: Medium Pro. Long slings to reduce rope drag. Set of pins or 3 boyscout bolts for belay.
content.location: Located on North/Northeast aspect. Hike off.

content.description: Low angled hand crack. Great intro trad lead.
content.protection: Medium Pro. Ring Anchors. All three of the can cracks can be climbed/top-roped off of the ring anchors with minimal swing potential.
content.location: Crack faces east but it is on the south/east side of the main formation. Cant miss it, just circle main formation til you see it

content.description: small warm up crack near split boulder
content.location: Standing in the east side parking spot of the split boulder look 35-50yards east/southeast towards a small group of boulders clustered together. The crack is located on the north side of this cluster of rock.

content.description: Sit start on east side of boulder.
content.location: Boulder is located 100 yards or so east of split boulder. From split boulder follow dirt road heading toward main formation. Dirt road drives right up to the boulder.

content.description: Hand/Fist crack.
content.protection: Medium Pro. Ring Anchors up top. All three of the can cracks can be top-roped off the anchors.
content.location: Faces East. On the south/east side of the main formation.

content.description: Named for a memorial to a pet cat near the parking area.  Not sure who bolted this route. 6th bolt seems to be in some suspect rock.  Otherwise well bolted, fun, and wanders a bit.
content.protection: 8 bolts plus 2 for anchors.  Maybe a couple double length slings for the wandering parts.
content.location: North side of of the feature.  Near Morning Dove.

content.description: Steep Slab. Crimps and Pockets.
content.location: Located on the North/Northwest aspect of main formation next to decap route and "Patella Juice".

content.description: Squeeze your way up between the two boulders, the further in you go, the narrower the exit. Really cool top out; Exhale to move up, inhale to lock yourself in place.
content.location: South side of the formation, below Modelo/Canned/Jawbreaker

content.description: Finger crack boulder problem.
content.location: This problem can be found on the way to "Patella Juice" and the decap routes if hiking from the west side.

content.description:
Another fun, short route. Start on the left of the large chockstone. Pull the bulge, climb the crack/slab, and exit right at the top of the chockstone. Pull jugs to the top. No protection going from the top of the chockstone to the top of the route. Definitely needs a bolt or 2. Next time i'm in the area I'll try to throw some in. Unless someone wants to beat me to it.

No rap anchors. Use boulders/crack on top to 2nd, and clean.
content.protection:
You can girth hitch a sling at the bottom where the large boulder meets the wall.

Medium to large pro.
content.location:
On the west side of the three peaks mound, next to the gangsta tag of the headless guy.

See Patella Juice beta photo.

content.description:
Fun route. Start on the left of the large chockstone. Pull the bulge, climb the crack/slab, and exit left through the awkward squeeze.

No rap anchors. Use boulders/crack on top to 2nd, and clean.
content.protection:
You can girth hitch a sling at the bottom where the large boulder meets the wall.

Medium to large pro.
content.location:
On the west side of the three peaks mound, next to the gangsta tag of the headless guy.

See Patella Juice beta photo.

content.description: Start right hand on arete, left hand low sidepull crimper. Techy feet beta, move right hand to high crimp, move feet, hit far left edge. Moves up and leftish for the most part. This problem is rad!
content.location: "Split Boulder"....... There is one main dirt road that circles the entire three peaks formation. If you can find this you will eventually run into the split boulder if your on the right path. Go with your gut, if you drive it, it will come.

content.description: This is a nice face with hand full of less than vertical boulder problems. The rock is nice Granite and the holds are rounded pockets. There are a few lines that go straight up the face and it can also be traversed in both directions. The traverses are the hardest lines.
content.location: The wall is located on the western spur of the Three Peaks crag. It faces south. It is easy to spot because its flat face looks out of place amongst the rounded formations that surround it.

content.description: Tuffa start to weird jamming. Might as well climb if your set up on Jawbreaker and Modelo.
content.protection: Medium Pro. Ring Anchors up top. All three can-cracks can be top-roped of the ring anchors.
content.location: Faces East. South/East side of the main formation.

content.description: Climb up the easy left facing dihedral through the squeeze chimney and up super easy slab to bolted anchors.  Not recommended as a Top rope as the rope would see lots abrasion over the slab at the top before the anchor bolts.
content.protection: Trad rack up to 3 inches to a bolted anchor.
content.location: Canal of Guilt is on the South side of the rock formation just right of a big roof. Walk off to the right.

content.description:
Cool highball (solo?) up a stack of square-ish boulders.

Start low in the crack, leaning to the right and away from the sharp pointy bush. Slither your way up and right with the crack until you can mantle up onto the first block.

A horizontal hand crack will bring you out into open air - a pad and spotters may be nice here. Carefully and awkwardly mantle up onto the second tier.

Face climb the third block where a pocket and large crimp will help with the third mantle.

You're almost to the top of the formation so you might as well keep going. Hop on over to the last block, or for the real fun move right, down to the adjacent 3rd level block. From here a heady V0 move or two starting on the right arete gets you to the large white horn on the top right, then up the fourth tier block. After this point I forget how I pulled off the mantle but it was an easy-ish move on good holds. No amount of pads would do you any good up here though...

This could almost be a trad climb but with a nice runout up top. A few good places for gear but it wanders and a top belay may be tough. Factor in a heck of a swing on the last tier, and, on second thought, a rope won't be much help anyway.
content.location: Right of Lap Crack, on the west face of the cluster of boulders just a few yards separated from the main formation's West/Northwest side.

content.description: Technical slab intro. Crimps, Pockets.
content.protection: 5 Bolts to rings anchors. Shares anchor with "Wind and Weiners".
content.location: South side of main formation. Left of "Wind and Weiners".
